title: UPDATE 1-Canadian Pacific Railway union serves strike notice
text:
May 26, 2018 / 7:30 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago UPDATE 1-Canadian 2 Min Read
(Adds details, context)
Some 3000 conductors and locomotive engineers voted 98.1 percent to reject CPâ€™s final offer on Friday, while about 360 signals and communications employees voted 97.2 percent to authorize strike action, the statement said. Commuter train services would not be affected in the event of a strike by Teamster members.
The labor strife comes at a time of tighter rail capacity in Canada, with CP and rival Canadian National Railway facing strong demand for shipments of grain, potash and other commodities.
The union members are committed to working with federal mediators to reach negotiated settlement and are willing to remain at the bargaining table until the May 29 strike deadline and beyond, the statement added.
The workers, whose collective agreement expired late last year, are asking for more predictable schedules to combat crew fatigue, among other demands. Nomiyama and Marguerita Choy)
